poem:
### The Wound

In the hall of echoes,
lost tongues profess
what truth has buried;

hands once clasped
now point like knives,
their shadows long

among the graves,
where silence
is a louder voice

than any spoken.
Here, lies are laid
bare as winter trees,

the cold shadow of power
a frostbite on the living.
